oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Frances W. Preston Interviewed by John Lomax III Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Frances W. Preston being interviewed by John Lomax III. The interview takes place on 1-19-1983
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Frances W. Preston
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two (0:34) -- Frances Preston discusses BMI's system for discovering songs. (1:47) -- Frances Preston explains the difficulty of having a number one song. (2:12) -- John Lomax asks Frances Preston the difference between a 'good' and a 'great' song. Frances Preston uses "Gentle On My Mind" as an example of a great song. (5:08) -- John Lomax asks Frances Preston where country music will be in 1990. (5:45) -- John Lomax asks about the Nashville Number System. Frances Preston mentions Grady Martin, Harold Bradley, Owen Bradley, Chet Atkins.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Preston, Frances Williams, 1928-2012;
